item.title: Report X-2024070083
item.description:
Report X-2024070083

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: ROUND ROCK
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY SEVEN POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING FOOD. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. OUTER BOX IS PREPRINTED PERISHABLE. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING A UPS AIR SHIPPING DOCUMENT WITHOUT A UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER. SHIPPER AND CONSIGNEE ARE VERY FAINT BUT APPEAR TO BE SHIPPER: SCOTT DILLON, WORLD MKTG COMPANY, 1010 STILLHOUSE SPG, ROUND ROCK TX 78681, 512-992-9044. THE CONSIGNEE IS ALLEN SMITH, NATIVE AMERICAN ENTERPRISES, 1230 N. WEST ST, WICHITA KS 67203, 931-585-1481.

item.title: Report X-2024070078
item.description:
Report X-2024070078

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-24
  • City: MC ALLEN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HAZMAT RESPONDER DISCOVERED DAMAGED AND LEAKING CARTON ON PALLET OUTSIDE DMP AREA, INSIDE TOTE. CORROSIVE DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL WAS CLEARLY VISIBLE, SO SHE DONNED PPE, INCLUDING SILVER SHIELD GLOVES, AND PROCEEDED TO NEUTRALIZE THE LEAKING ACID WITH SODIUM BICARBONATE. RESPONDER VERIFIED THAT THE SUBSTANCE WAS NEUTRALIZED USING PH TAPE. THE CONTAMINATED CARDBOARD, CLAY ABSORBANT, SODIUM BICARBONATE AND THE ENTIRE AUTOMOTIVE BATTERY WAS PLACED INSIDE A GREEN BAG. MORE SODIUM BICARBONATE AND CLAY ABSORBANT WERE ADDED TO THE BAG IN ORDER TO CATCH ANY MORE ACID THAT MAY LEAK FROM THE BATTERY.

item.title: Report I-2024050079
item.description:
Report I-2024050079

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T00:36:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: Fort Worth
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS MINIBULK, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PVS Minibulk driver was scheduled to deliver a shipment of Sodium Hypochlorite 12.5% to Cintas in Fort Worth, TX. Driver arrived on site and proceeded to the offloading location. Once at the offloading location the driver proceeded to make the delivery. During the end of the delivery approximately 7 gallons of Sodium Hypochlorite 12.5% was released into containment.

item.title: Report X-2024061437

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-27T15:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: SANGER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 17, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and adjacent cargo. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. The crew overpacked the damaged pail in one (1) 30-gallon drum. LSH personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 14, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of resin solutiion was leaking due to shipper error and released approximately ten (10) ounces of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel placed the damaged 55-gallon drum of product into one (1) 95-gallon drum. Crews secured the scene and demobilized.

item.title: Report E-2024060574
item.description:
Report E-2024060574

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-27T15:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-14
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 14, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3264 was punctured and released approximately thirty-five (35) gallons of product to the trailer interior and concrete below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH deployed absorbents to the impacted trailer and concrete surfaces. All impacted absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into four (4) 55-gallon drums and staged onsite for disposal. The damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 95-gallon drum.

  • Description: Package was found in QA damage area in a repack box. Shipping and diamond labels were taped to the new box. The word "damaged" was written on outer box. Original box is missing. Inner box containing 2 of the 4 plastic bottles was wet in the corner. 1 bottle outside of the inner box had a loose cap. The other bottle next to it was wet near the cap. Bottles were still mostly full.
